blocks.text: Application of these Rules to the Solution of Differential Equations.
This equation might be written as

blocks.description: The characteristic equation associated with the differential equation.

blocks.text: The solution of this equation gives the particular integral, whilst the complementary function, as it is termed, will be obtained by the solution of the equation

blocks.description: The characteristic equation used to find the complementary function.
The particular integral derived from the characteristic equation.
The overall solution to the differential equation.

blocks.text: To test this by differentiation of the result—

blocks.description: Verification of the solution through substitution into the original equation.

blocks.text: This type of equation occurs frequently in electrical problems and in problems on forced vibrations of a system.
